Hydration refers to the attaching of React to HTML which was already rendered in a server environment.

results.t: ReactDOM.hydrate is no longer supported in React 18 #227
results.p: Mar 31, 2022 — ReactDOM.hydrate is no longer supported in React 18. Use hydrateRoot instead. Until you switch to the new API, your app will behave as if ...
Hydration is the process of using client-side JavaScript to add application state and interactivity to server-rendered HTML.

results.t: What is hydration in react? : r/reactjs
results.p: The idea of hydration is that it lets you start with a completely rendered page, then it makes that rendered page work.
hydrateRoot lets you display React components inside a browser DOM node whose HTML content was previously generated by react-dom/server.

results.t: Best Practices for React Hydration in Server-Side Rendering
results.p: React Hydration is the process of making a server-rendered React app fully interactive on the client side. Learn about React hydration in detail.
